reviews.review_msg: Hands down the best professor I have ever had. Im so annoyed SFU is letting him leave. They should pay him a ton of money for him to stay because he is so worth it!! He is so organized that it doesnt seem like he is teaching you a lot. You never feel crammed and you actually want to learn because he doesnt stress you out. Outstanding prof!

As said before - nice guy. I also found the class really interesting. However his approach to teaching the class is far too disorganized - especially for an upper division engineering class. There is also a group project for which he provided few instructions until the very end - i.e. one week before due date. Would not take again.

He is nice, but he can't teach. He says that project is some percentage of your grade but will say in the end that he won't issue any grade *for the entire course* if you didn't do, let's say one assignment related to project.

ENSC 488 is much easier with shahram than Kamal. My advice is to avoid 488 if you can..shahram lecture useless...assignment are same as previous years...he gives B- to B+ to everyone, but you would not learn anything..i learnt absolutely nothing in this course.....
This prof is a horrible prof and stink at explaining things.  Professor who stink at explaining things
This prof is a horrible prof.  Professor who stink at explaining things

Lectures are heavy and you do have lots of assignments. However, the course is very interesting and prof is always open to help. Project is time consuming, but also essential to understand the course material and fun to do
He doesn't know how to teach you at all! just go through the textbook and learn from it. At lot of workload and no study materials(assignment, MTs solution etc.)

This professor repeats the materials in the textbook without further examples. No solutions to the assignment, midterm to study. This professor materials does not help with doing the project. No sample input/output of the project and time consuming. If you are taking this course with him, better not take any other heavy courses.
Too much work. TA sucks. Read the textbook and save yourself tons of time
Smart and Cool. Very fair and helpful to students.
